messages.message: By the way -- you can always bypass these checks by using `git commit -n ` if something is broken. No one should get blocked on pre-commit scripts failing.

no-verify is useful when you want to reduce git diff size
```git commit -m "dummy" --no-verify```
-n or --no-verify
True, though then we bypass `yapf` and other checks which mess up the PR with formatting diffs. We were not truly blocked of course, just a minor fix worked.
yes by some mistake at some point, pycharm was not running pre-commit and I had several messed PRs (messed styling wise). Since then I learned that I dont like to bypass it :stuck_out_tongue:

Well, regarding formatting/linting/type-checking in Python and JS -- CI *should* double-check anything that the pre-commit checks check. Not sure if currently true..."never trust the client" and all that :)
So long as the AST is the same, mypy doesn't care.
